alert.note: Alert for Roseau (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 8:15PM CDT until May 03 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Twin Valley affecting Norman County. Marsh River at Shelly affecting Norman County. Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Sand Hill River at Climax affecting Polk County. Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. Roseau River at Roseau affecting Roseau County. .Additional rises are still expected on tributaries across northwest Minnesota at many locations as additional flow works into river systems. Decreases are forecast at Shelly, Warren, and Twin Valley where the rivers have likely crested. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Roseau River at Roseau. * WHEN...From Monday morning to early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD STAGE. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.0 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
